reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on.
In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is enormous.
Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge.
For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo.
In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization.
The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another.
We'll see that this is true also of health and disease: there are many causes of illness, but their manifestations at the physiological and symptomatic levels are often strikingly similar.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: to criticize a theory by Conrad Waddington
to list the similarities between health and disease
to explain the concept of canalization in biology
to describe the molecular interactions within a cell
to argue for the complexity of human embryo development

answer.explanation: 이 글은 생명과 같은 복잡한 시스템이 어떻게 안정성을 유지하는지에 대한 원리를 설명하고 있습니다. 이를 위해 생물학자 콘래드 웨딩턴이 명명한 '경로화(canalization)'라는 핵심 개념을 소개하고, 인간 배아의 발달과 질병의 발현을 예로 들어 설명합니다. 따라서 글의 주된 목적은 '생물학에서의 경로화 개념을 설명하기 위함'입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on.
In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is enormous.
Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge.
For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo.
In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization.
The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another.
We'll see that this is true also of health and disease: there are many causes of illness, but their manifestations at the physiological and symptomatic levels are often strikingly similar.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: The Infinite Possibilities of a Single Cell
Canalization: How Complexity Leads to Simplicity
A Physicist's View on Human Health
The Rough Landscape of Human Development
Why Illnesses Have So Many Different Symptoms

answer.explanation: 이 글의 핵심 내용은 생명과 같이 매우 복잡한('complexity') 시스템이 안정성을 유지하기 위해 가능한 결과의 수를 급격히 줄여 몇 가지 정해진 상태로만 나타난다는 것입니다. 이는 일종의 '단순성(simplicity)'으로 귀결됩니다. 이 과정을 '경로화(canalization)'라고 부르므로, '경로화: 복잡성이 어떻게 단순성으로 이어지는가'라는 제목이 글의 중심 사상을 가장 잘 포착합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on.
In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is enormous.
Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge.
For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo.
In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization.
The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another.
We'll see that this is true also of health and disease: there are many causes of illness, but their manifestations at the physiological and symptomatic levels are often strikingly similar.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Stability in complex biological systems is achieved through canalization, which drastically limits the number of possible outcomes.
The development of a human embryo is a completely random process that has an almost infinite number of possible outcomes.
The concept of canalization explains why there are so many different and unique symptoms for every single human disease.
According to physicists, a 'high-dimensional system' is a very simple system in which only a few things are happening.
Conrad Waddington's primary contribution to biology was his research into the molecular interactions within single cells.

answer.explanation: 이 글의 핵심 주장은 생명과 같은 복잡한 생물학적 시스템이 안정성을 유지하는 원리에 관한 것입니다. 시스템 내에는 무수히 많은 상호작용이 가능하지만, 안정성을 위해 가능한 결과의 수가 급격히 줄어들어 몇 가지 정해진 상태로만 나타나는데, 이 과정을 '경로화(canalization)'라고 부릅니다. 따라서 '복잡한 생물학적 시스템의 안정성은 가능한 결과의 수를 급격히 제한하는 경로화를 통해 달성된다'는 ①번이 글의 요지로 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on. In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is enormous. Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge. For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo. ( ① ) The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them. ( ② ) This is rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another. ( ③ ) We'll see that this is true also of health and disease: there are many causes of illness, but their manifestations are often strikingly similar. ( ④ ) This principle helps us understand patterns in complex systems. ( ⑤ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization.**

options.text: ①
②
③
④
⑤

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 '1942년에 생물학자 콘래드 웨딩턴이 이 급격한 결과의 축소를 경로화라고 불렀다'는 내용입니다. '이 급격한 결과의 축소(this drastic narrowing of outcomes)'라는 표현은 바로 앞 문장에서 언급된 '인간 배아 발달로부터 오직 제한된 수의 조직과 신체 형태만이 나올 수 있다'는 구체적인 예시를 가리킵니다. 따라서 예시를 제시한 후 그 현상에 대한 전문 용어를 소개하는 것이 가장 자연스러운 흐름이므로, 정답은 ①번입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on. In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is enormous.

question_blocks.A: For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo. In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization.
question_blocks.B: Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge.
question_blocks.C: The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 생명 시스템의 엄청난 복잡성을 소개합니다. (B)에서는 '그러한 시스템(Such a system)'이 안정성을 유지하기 위한 조건(결과의 수가 적어야 함)을 제시하며 자연스럽게 이어집니다. (A)에서는 'For example'을 사용하여 (B)에서 제시된 원칙의 구체적인 예시(인간 배아)를 들고, 그 현상에 '경로화'라는 이름을 붙입니다. 마지막으로 (C)에서는 '경로화'의 개념을 거친 지형의 공에 비유하여 더 자세히 설명합니다. 따라서 (B)-(A)-(C)가 가장 논리적인 순서입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Life is a 'high-dimensional system,' where the number of possible interactions between molecules is enormous. Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge. For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo. The biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization. The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape [____________________]. We'll see that this is true also of health and disease.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: can stay balanced on a peak
may fly over the entire area
must roll to the bottom of one valley or another
can choose its own path freely
stops moving as soon as it lands

answer.explanation: 이 글은 생명체가 중간의 임의적인 상태로 존재할 수 없고, 몇 가지 정해진 상태 중 하나를 선택해야 한다는 '경로화' 개념을 설명하고 있습니다. 빈칸은 이 개념을 '거친 지형의 공'에 비유하는 부분입니다. 공이 언덕 중턱의 임의적인 지점에 머물 수 없고 결국 '이 계곡 또는 저 계곡의 바닥으로 굴러가야만 한다'는 비유가, 생명체가 정해진 몇 가지 안정된 상태 중 하나로 귀결된다는 개념과 가장 잘 어울립니다. 따라서 빈칸에는 ③번이 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on. In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is ① [enormous]. Such a system can only hope to be ② [stable] if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge. For example, it is only a ③ [limited] number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo. In 1942, Conrad Waddington called this drastic ④ [broadening] of outcomes canalization. The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: ① enormous
② stable
③ limited
④ broadening
⑤ random

answer.explanation: 콘래드 웨딩턴이 '경로화(canalization)'라고 명명한 것은 복잡한 시스템에서 가능한 결과의 수가 급격하게 '줄어드는 것'을 의미합니다. 이는 앞서 언급된 '더 적은 수의 집단적 존재 방식(a smaller number of collective ways of being)'과 '제한된 수의 조직과 신체 형태(a limited number of tissues and body shapes)'와 같은 맥락입니다. 따라서 결과의 '확장(broadening)'이라는 단어는 문맥에 맞지 않으며, '축소(narrowing)'가 와야 합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Life is a 'high-dimensional system,' in which the number of possible (A) [interactions] is enormous. Such a system can only hope to be (B) [stable] if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge. For example, it is only a limited number of tissues that may (C) [result] from the development of a human embryo. Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization. The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states. We'll see that this is true also of health and disease: there are many causes of illness, but their (D) [manifestations] at the physiological and (E) [symptomatic] levels are often strikingly similar.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) interactions: actions that have an effect on each other
(B) stable: not likely to move or change
(C) result: to be the cause of something
(D) manifestations: signs of something existing or happening
(E) symptomatic: showing symptoms of a particular disease

answer.explanation: (C) 본문에서 'result from'은 '~로부터 결과로 생겨나다'라는 의미입니다. 즉, 배아의 발달이 '원인'이고 조직과 신체 형태가 '결과'입니다. 영영 풀이 'to be the cause of something (무언가의 원인이 되다)'는 'result in'에 대한 설명이며, 'result from'과는 인과관계가 반대입니다. 따라서 ③번의 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Life is a 'high-dimensional system,' in which the number of possible interactions between different molecules is (A) [enormous / minimal]. Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a (B) [smaller / larger] number of collective ways of being may emerge. For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo. In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic (C) [narrowing / expansion] of outcomes canalization. The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: enormous - smaller - narrowing
enormous - larger - expansion
minimal - smaller - narrowing
minimal - larger - expansion
enormous - smaller - expansion

answer.explanation: (A) 단일 세포 내 분자 간의 상호작용 가능성의 수는 '막대하다(enormous)'고 했습니다. 'minimal'은 '아주 적은'이라는 뜻입니다. (B) 이러한 시스템이 안정적이려면 '더 적은(smaller)' 수의 존재 방식이 나타나야 합니다. 'larger'는 '더 큰'이라는 뜻입니다. (C) 콘래드 웨딩턴은 이러한 결과의 급격한 '축소(narrowing)'를 경로화라고 불렀습니다. 'expansion'은 '확장'이라는 뜻입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' which is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on.
In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules is enormous.
Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge.
For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that may result from the development of a human embryo.
In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes canalization.
The organism may switch between a small number of well-defined possible states, but can't exist in random states in between them, rather as a ball in a rough landscape must roll to the bottom of one valley or another.
We'll see that this is true also of health and disease: there are many causes of illness, but their manifestations at the physiological and symptomatic levels are often strikingly similar.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 글의 내용과 일치하지 않는 것은?

options.text: A complex system needs to limit its outcomes to be stable.
A human embryo can develop into only a limited number of body shapes.
The term 'canalization' was coined by a physicist in 1942.
An organism cannot exist in random states between well-defined ones.
Different diseases can show similar symptoms, illustrating canalization.

answer.explanation: 본문은 '1942년에 생물학자 콘래드 웨딩턴이(the biologist Conrad Waddington)... 경로화라고 불렀다'고 명시하고 있습니다. 따라서 이 용어를 물리학자가 만들었다는 ③번은 글의 내용과 일치하지 않습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: ① Life is what physicists might call a 'high-dimensional system,' [which / that] is their fancy way of saying that there's a lot going on. ② In just a single cell, the number of possible interactions between different molecules [is / are] enormous. ③ Such a system can only hope to be stable if only a smaller number of collective ways of being may emerge. ④ For example, it is only a limited number of tissues and body shapes that [may result / may be resulted] from the development of a human embryo. ⑤ In 1942, the biologist Conrad Waddington called this drastic narrowing of outcomes [canalization / to be canalization].
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 앞선 절 전체 또는 'high-dimensional system'을 선행사로 받아 부연 설명하는 계속적 용법의 관계대명사 자리입니다. 콤마(,) 뒤의 계속적 용법으로는 관계대명사 'that'을 사용할 수 없으므로 'which'가 맞습니다.
이 문장의 주어는 'the number'입니다. 'of possible interactions'는 주어를 수식하는 전치사구입니다. 주어가 단수이므로 단수 동사인 'is'가 와야 합니다.
'It is ~ that' 강조 구문으로, 'a limited number of tissues and body shapes'가 강조되고 있습니다. 이 명사구가 뒤따르는 동사 'result from'의 주어 역할을 하므로, 능동태인 'may result'가 맞습니다. 'result'는 자동사이므로 수동태로 쓰이지 않습니다.
동사 'call'은 5형식으로 'call + 목적어 + 목적격 보어'의 구조를 가집니다. 여기서 목적어는 'this drastic narrowing of outcomes'이고, 목적격 보어 자리에는 명사인 'canalization'이 와야 합니다.
